intro: Eriophyllum latilobum, commonly known as the narrowleaf heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Oregon. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant has slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats. Eriophyllum latilobum is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
